figure_2.title: Figure 2.
figure_2.caption:
Study payments, by declaration statement
*5 Studies declared funding, which was not found in the “Open Payments” Database

figure_3.title: Figure 3.
figure_3.caption:
Author Payments, by declaration statement
* 24 Authors declared funding which was not found in the “Open Payments” Database

figure_4.title: Figure 4.
figure_4.caption: Proportion of Authors with an undeclared payment, by (a) total amount received and (b) author order

claims.sentence: A total of 458 studies met our inclusion criteria (Figure 1), which included 2,253 American Authors.

We could not include these studies in the analyses of the size amounts of payments. (Figure 2)
Figure 2.

In the studies that only partially declared their payments (N = 29), we found that the average amount which was undeclared was $3,456 (Range $55 – $41,803).Author Level Results
At the author level, a total of 575 authors (25.5%) received at least one payment from Intuitive Surgical, Inc. (Figure 3).

Only 18.1% (N = 104/575) of authors who received payments declared it in a COI statement. (Figure 3) In the studies with a declaration statement present in which authors received a payment, 78.4% (377 of 481) did not declare it so.

The average declared amount of individual payments was $55,170 (Median $10,035, IQR $202 – $60,994) compared with $6,967 (Median $602, IQR $118 – $3,092) in undeclared payments
For those authors who received at least one payment, we found that undeclared funding was associated with author order (First author 83.1% vs. Middle Author 90.0% vs. Last Author 77.9%, P < 0.001). (Figure 4) The amount received was then categorized ($1 – $500; $500 – $1,000; $1,000 – $10,000; $10,000 – $100,000; >$100,000) to assess for an association.

We found that authors were less likely to disclose a conflict of interest at lower payment amounts. (Figure 4) However, 30% of all authors who received over $100,000 from Intuitive did not disclose payments from Intuitive in the COI statement.
A total of 458 studies met our inclusion criteria (Figure 1), which included 2,253 American Authors.

We could not include these studies in the analyses of the size amounts of payments. (Figure 2)

We could not include these studies in the analyses of the size amounts of payments. (Figure 2).

Author Level Results
At the author level, a total of 575 authors (25.5%) received at least one payment from Intuitive Surgical, Inc. (Figure 3).

Only 18.1% (N = 104/575) of authors who received payments declared it in a COI statement. (Figure 3) In the studies with a declaration statement present in which authors received a payment, 78.4% (377 of 481) did not declare it so.

The average declared amount of individual payments was $55,170 (Median $10,035, IQR $202 – $60,994) compared with $6,967 (Median $602, IQR $118 – $3,092) in undeclared payments
For those authors who received at least one payment, we found that undeclared funding was associated with author order (First author 83.1% vs. Middle Author 90.0% vs. Last Author 77.9%, P < 0.001). (Figure 4) The amount received was then categorized ($1 – $500; $500 – $1,000; $1,000 – $10,000; $10,000 – $100,000; >$100,000) to assess for an association.

We found that authors were less likely to disclose a conflict of interest at lower payment amounts. (Figure 4) However, 30% of all authors who received over $100,000 from Intuitive did not disclose payments from Intuitive in the COI statement.
At the author level, a total of 575 authors (25.5%) received at least one payment from Intuitive Surgical, Inc. (Figure 3).

Only 18.1% (N = 104/575) of authors who received payments declared it in a COI statement. (Figure 3) In the studies with a declaration statement present in which authors received a payment, 78.4% (377 of 481) did not declare it so.

For those authors who received at least one payment, we found that undeclared funding was associated with author order (First author 83.1% vs. Middle Author 90.0% vs. Last Author 77.9%, P < 0.001). (Figure 4) The amount received was then categorized ($1 – $500; $500 – $1,000; $1,000 – $10,000; $10,000 – $100,000; >$100,000) to assess for an association.

We found that authors were less likely to disclose a conflict of interest at lower payment amounts. (Figure 4) However, 30% of all authors who received over $100,000 from Intuitive did not disclose payments from Intuitive in the COI statement.
